leads.personalizationAnchor: REDARC extended 3-year partnership for Hoops & Her program; custom coaches boards launched; strong 2025 participation milestones
leads.draftedIntro:
Hi there,

Saw that REDARC extended their partnership for another 3 years with your Hoops & Her program — that's a huge vote of confidence in what you're building for women's basketball in SA.

I'm Michael from CourtLab, an Adelaide-based startup built by a local coach/dad who got tired of glitchy, expensive apps. We help clubs automate shooting stats and player film so coaches save time and players get verified data to "Become Undeniable."

Given your focus on pathways and player development with Hoops & Her, thought CourtLab might be a fit. Worth a quick look?

courtlab.app | https://apps.apple.com/us/app/courtlab-basketball-trainer/id6757304855

Cheers,
Michael
leads.notes: NBL1 Central, 60+ district teams, major sponsor REDARC

leads.personalizationAnchor: Adelaide's biggest basketball club with 60+ district teams; runs Easter Classic Tournament and Holiday Skills Camps
leads.draftedIntro:
Hi there,

Noticed you describe yourselves as Adelaide's biggest basketball club with 60+ district teams — that's serious scale. Also saw you run the Easter Classic and Holiday Skills Camps.

I'm Michael from CourtLab, an Adelaide-based startup built by a local coach/dad. We help clubs automate shooting stats and player film so coaches save time and players get verified data to track improvement.

With that many teams and camps, I imagine tracking player development across the board gets challenging. CourtLab was built to solve exactly that — no more spiral notebooks or guesswork.

Worth a quick look? courtlab.app

Cheers,
Michael
leads.notes: Biggest club in Adelaide, The ARC facility, runs major tournaments

leads.personalizationAnchor: Claims 'most professional and successful junior program in SA'; strong NBL1 pathway with players going pro internationally
leads.draftedIntro:
Hi there,

Saw that Sturt positions itself as the most professional and successful junior program in SA — and that many of your graduates are now playing professionally around the world. That's an incredible pathway.

I'm Michael from CourtLab, an Adelaide-based startup built by a local coach/dad. We help clubs give players verified data and film to support their development and recruitment journeys.

With so many players moving to pro levels, having portable, verified stats that travel with them from U12s to college/pro could be valuable. Built this because other apps (HomeCourt, Pure Sweat) were too glitchy for local clubs.

Worth exploring? courtlab.app

Cheers,
Michael
leads.notes: Most successful junior program, strong NBL1, pro player pipeline

leads.personalizationAnchor: Mini 3agles (3v3) program running Term 1 at Wayville — building skills and confidence in fast-paced format; Zane's club (warm lead)
leads.draftedIntro:
Hi [Name],

Love what you're doing with the Mini 3agles program — that 3v3 format is brilliant for building skills and confidence in a fun, fast-paced environment. My son Zane plays U12s at Forestville and we've seen firsthand how the club develops players.

I'm Michael, founder of CourtLab — an Adelaide-based startup I built because I got tired of glitchy apps that didn't work for local clubs like ours. We help automate shooting stats and player film so coaches save time and players get verified data.

Given Forestville's focus on development pathways, thought it might be worth a conversation. Happy to show you how it works.

courtlab.app

Cheers,
Michael (Zane's dad)
leads.notes: Zane plays here — warmest lead. Mini 3agles program is active now.
